alert.note: Alert for Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 2:28PM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM MONDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches in the valleys. As you head towards Mazama, up to 10 inches of snowfall. The mountains will see 6 to 18 inches, with higher amounts at the crest of the Cascades. Winds gusting as high as 20 mph in the valleys Tuesday. Mountain wind gusts up to 50 mph Tuesday. * WHERE...Mazama, Methow, Winthrop, Conconully, Twisp, and Loup Loup Pass. * WHEN...From 10 AM Monday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday evening through Wednesday morning commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
